summary: Website for uploading and displaying photographs with restricted upload access (owner/admin can upload; public viewers can only browse the gallery).
architectural_notes: Homepage/landing visual direction: warm autumn sunset vibe (falling leaves), consistent across hero/background and overall theme.
Introduce simple access control/roles: uploader (authorized) vs viewer (public read-only).
known_issues: Build failed due to a configuration problem (Caffeine build/config error).

existing_features.title: Create a frontend page that allows users to upload photographs from their device and submit them to the backend, including client-side validation for common image types (e.g., JPEG/PNG/WebP) and a clear success/error message in English.

Create a responsive photo gallery UI that displays uploaded photographs in a clean grid layout, loading photo metadata from the backend and rendering the images. Include a basic photo viewer interaction (e.g., click to open a larger view).
Wire frontend data fetching and mutations using React Query (upload mutation + list query) and ensure cache invalidation/refresh after uploads so the gallery stays consistent.

Apply a coherent, distinct visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) across the app suitable for a photography gallery. Do not use a blue+purple theme. Keep the design consistent across upload and gallery views.

Redesign the current single-page home layout (header + upload + gallery) into a more landing-page style experience aimed at first-time visitors coming from Instagram, while keeping all existing upload and gallery functionality available on the same page.
Add clear calls-to-action in the hero section that guide visitors to the primary actions on the page (e.g., scrolling/jumping to the Upload section and/or the Gallery section).

Update the header content/layout to better match a landing-page style (e.g., compact brand area plus simple navigation links to page sections like “Upload” and “Gallery”), without removing existing branding.

Add at least one additional landing-page section between the hero and the app content that improves first impression (e.g., a short “What you’ll find here”/highlights section) using English user-facing text.
Incorporate a generated static hero background/illustration image into the landing hero section and store it in frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve it from the backend).
Update the base HTML metadata to match the landing-page positioning (title and optionally a meta description) while keeping it generic (no references to Instagram-specific account details).

Update the homepage visual theme to evoke “falling autumn leaves, sunset time” using a cohesive warm palette (amber/orange/copper/burgundy) and matching surfaces, borders, and accents across the landing header, hero, highlights, upload, gallery, dialogs, and footer while keeping all existing functionality unchanged.

Update the hero section styling to match the autumn-sunset theme by adjusting overlays/gradients and any hero text emphasis colors so the background and content feel like a warm sunset scene with drifting leaves, without changing the hero’s existing CTA behavior.
Update the frontend so public visitors can browse the gallery and open photos, but cannot see or use the upload form unless they are authenticated and authorized to upload.
Add frontend authentication UI controls using Internet Identity so the owner can sign in to upload, and non-owners can optionally sign in but still remain read-only if not authorized.

Add a “Copy share link” action to the photo viewer that generates a short URL using the current site origin plus a short-code parameter and copies it to the clipboard, showing a clear success/error message in English.
Enable opening a photo directly from a short link by detecting the short-code parameter on initial page load and automatically opening the corresponding photo in the existing photo viewer dialog.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a website that lets users upload photographs and display them in a clean gallery layout.

Implement backend photo storage and retrieval in the single Motoko main actor, supporting: (1) uploading a photograph (raw bytes) with basic metadata (filename, content type, upload timestamp), (2) listing uploaded photographs (metadata only) in reverse-chronological order, and (3) fetching a photograph by id (bytes + content type).
Redesign the homepage to be more landing-page style for visitors coming from Instagram (more polished intro/hero section, clearer call-to-action, improved first impression).
Update the landing/homepage visual theme to evoke “falling autumn leaves at sunset time” (warm amber/orange palette and matching hero styling/background).
Add access control so only authorized users can upload photos, while general frontend visitors can only view/browse the gallery (read-only).
Add backend access control so that only an authorized principal (the gallery owner/admin) can upload photos, while all visitors can still list and view photos.

Implement an owner/admin bootstrapping and authorization mechanism in the Motoko canister that supports a single owner by default (with an optional allowlist), and expose query methods needed by the frontend to determine whether the current caller is allowed to upload.
Support shortening the public link/URL for the site (e.g., via custom domain and/or short redirect link).
Add backend support for short photo links by storing and resolving short codes that map to existing photo IDs.
